Grouped_Utterances: I’ve been okay. I tried meditating a few times, but it’s still tough. I felt a bit restless at first, but I noticed some moments of calm towards the end. Yes, I’ve tried focusing on my breath when I feel anxious, and it helps a little. Mostly when I’m alone or when I think about my mom. I’ve been trying to remind myself of the good memories with her, but it’s still hard. It makes me feel happy and sad at the same time.
I remember going to the beach with her. We would spend hours just talking and laughing. I feel hopeful. It’s nice to have things to work towards.
I guess I’m still worried about my depression. I just don’t want to feel this way forever.
I think it helps. I feel a little more energized afterward.
It’s been good! I’ve been going for bike rides more regularly, which feels nice.
It’s completely valid to have those worries. Remember that depression can ebb and flow, and with the right tools and support, it can improve. We can continue to work on coping strategies together.

I thought about writing them down, maybe creating a scrapbook. That’s a beautiful idea! It could be a therapeutic way to honor her memory and process your feelings. Would you like to set a goal to start that this week? Yes, I think I’d like that. I’ve been thinking about joining a local sports group or something.  Yeah, I’d like to look into it. Let’s keep focusing on mindfulness and physical activity as tools to manage your feelings. Would you like to set another goal for the upcoming week? Yes, I’d like to commit to practicing meditation daily and working on my scrapbook.
